arts.ttl: PSG starts Champions League defense against Atalanta. Bayern-Chelsea, Ajax-Inter renew past finals
arts.sum: Both Ajax’s John Heitinga and Inter’s Cristian Chivu will be coaching their first career games in the Champions League with teams they once played for in the competition. Paris Saint-Germain starts the defense of its Champions League title on Wednesday when the six-game program includes two rematches of past finals.

arts.ttl: Nicolas Jackson speaks out on "emotional rollercoaster" move to Bayern
arts.sum: Nicolas Jackson has opened up on his dramatic move to Bayern Munich.

arts.ttl: Chelsea boss Maresca backs Bayern as Champions League favourites
arts.sum: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca has backed Bayern Munich as ‘one of the three or four favourites’ to win the Champions League this season. Maresca’s side face Bayern Munich at the Allianz Arena this evening in their opening fixture of the Champions League campaign. arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany sends heartfelt message to Raheem Sterling as Chelsea snub continues
arts.sum: Vincent Kompany has backed Raheem Sterling to eventually prove himself elsewhere as his Chelsea exile continues with the Blues beginning their Champions League campaign

arts.ttl: Bayern plan to make Chelsea rue letting Nicolas Jackson go in ominous reunion | Jacob Steinberg
arts.sum: Enzo Maresca’s side return to the site of the club’s first Champions League win but the team face a battle against their former striker A trip to the Allianz Arena offers Chelsea fond memories of the greatest night in their history, a meeting with two what‑might‑have-beens and a swift reunion with a player desperate to prove they were wrong to let him go. Perhaps Enzo Maresca will be feeling nervous if his team have to face Nicolas Jackson when they open their Champions League campaign against Bayern Munich on Wednesday night. There are plenty of examples of loanees coming back to haunt their parent club in the tournament and Jackson will not be short of motivation if he features against Chelsea less than a month since he left on loan. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Why Nicolas Jackson is eligible to play against Chelsea for Bayern Munich despite loan deal
arts.sum: Nicolas Jackson joined the German champions on a season-long loan deal from Chelsea, but he will be able to feature against his parent club in the Champions League
